definitions.definition: express the sense of (words or text) in another language.
examples: the German original has been translated into English
synonyms: transliterate "the German original had been translated into English"

definitions.definition: be expressed or be capable of being expressed in another language.
convert or be converted into (another form or medium).
examples: few of Shakespeare's other works have been translated into ballets
synonyms: explain More"be prepared to translate plenty of jargon"adapt
morph "interesting ideas cannot always be translated into effective movies"

definitions.definition: move from one place or condition to another.
examples: she had been translated from familiar surroundings to a foreign court

definitions.definition: move (a bishop) to another see or pastoral charge.
remove (a saint's relics) to another place.
convey (someone, typically still alive) to heaven.
convert (a sequence of nucleotides in messenger RNA) to an amino-acid sequence in a protein or polypeptide during synthesis.
cause (a body) to move so that all its parts travel in the same direction, without rotation or change of shape.
transform (a geometric figure) in an analogous way.
